RacialTrait.Name: Object of Desire
RacialTrait.Description: The changeling adds +1 to her caster level when casting charm person and charm monster. This replaces green widow.

RacialTrait.Name: Ocean's Daughter
RacialTrait.Description: The changeling gains a +1 trait bonus on Swim checks. She automatically succeeds at Swim checks made to avoid nonlethal damage from swimming. This racial trait replaces sea lungs.

RacialTrait.Name: Stats
RacialTrait.Description: Dhampirs are fast and seductive, but their racial bond to the undead impedes their mortal vigor, +2 Dexterity +2 Charisma -2 Constitution.

RacialTrait.Name: Dhampir
RacialTrait.Description: Dhampirs are humanoids with the dhampir subtype.

RacialTrait.Name: Medium
RacialTrait.Description: Dhampirs are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

RacialTrait.Name: Normal Speed
RacialTrait.Description: Dhampirs have a base speed of 30 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: SensesDhampir
RacialTrait.Description: Low-light vision and darkvision 60 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Manipulative
RacialTrait.Description: +2 racial bonus on Bluff and Perception.

RacialTrait.Name: Undead Resistance
RacialTrait.Description: Dhampirs gain a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against disease and mind-affecting effects.

RacialTrait.Name: Light Sensitivity
RacialTrait.Description: Dhampirs are dazzled in areas of bright sunlight or within the radius of a daylight spell.

RacialTrait.Name: Negative Energy Affinity
RacialTrait.Description: Though a living creature, a dhampir reacts to positive and negative energy as if it were undead—positive energy harms it, while negative energy heals it.

RacialTrait.Name: Spell-Like Ability
RacialTrait.Description: A dhampir can use detect undead three times per day as a spell-like ability. The caster level for this ability equals the dhampir's class level.

RacialTrait.Name: Resist Level Drain
RacialTrait.Description: A dhampir takes no penalties from energy drain effects, though he can still be killed if he accrues more negative levels then he has Hit Dice. After 24 hours, any negative levels a dhampir takes are removed without the need for an additional saving throw.

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Dhampirs begin play speaking Common. Those with high Intelligence scores can choose any language it wants (except secret languages, such as Druidic).

RacialTrait.Name: Dayborn
RacialTrait.Description: A few fortunate dhampirs were born during the day under the blessings of priests, and their blood has weaker ties to their undead bloodline than others of their kind. Such dhampirs are unhindered by daylight and lose the light sensitivity racial trait. Th

RacialTrait.Name: Fangs
RacialTrait.Description: On occasion, a dhampir may inherit his father's lengthy canines. Whenever the dhampir makes a grapple combat maneuver check to damage an opponent, he can choose to bite his opponent, dealing 1d3 points of damage as if using a natural bite attack. As a sta

RacialTrait.Name: Vampiric Empathy
RacialTrait.Description: Though dhampirs often relate poorly to humanoids, some share an affinity with baser creatures. These dhampirs gain the ability to communicate with bats, rats, and wolves as if under the effects of a speak with animals spell (caster level equal to 1/2 the

RacialTrait.Name: Stats
RacialTrait.Description: +2 Dexterity, +2 Charisma, –2 Constitution Drow are nimble and manipulative.

RacialTrait.Name: Elf
RacialTrait.Description: Drow are humanoids with the elf subtype.

RacialTrait.Name: Medium
RacialTrait.Description: Drow are Medium creatures and receive no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

RacialTrait.Name: Normal Speed
RacialTrait.Description: Drow have a base speed of 30 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Superior Darkvision
RacialTrait.Description: Drow can see in the dark up to 120 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Drow Immunities
RacialTrait.Description: Drow are immune to magic sleep effects and gain a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against enchantment spells and effects.

RacialTrait.Name: Keen Senses
RacialTrait.Description: Drow gain a +2 racial bonus on Perception checks.

RacialTrait.Name: Poison Use
RacialTrait.Description: Drow are skilled in the use of poison and never risk accidentally poisoning themselves.

RacialTrait.Name: Spell Resistance
RacialTrait.Description: Drow possess spell resistance equal to 6 plus their class levels.

RacialTrait.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
RacialTrait.Description: A drow can cast dancing lights, darkness, and faerie fire, once each per day, using her total character level as her caster level.

RacialTrait.Name: Light Blindness
RacialTrait.Description: Abrupt exposure to bright light blinds drow for 1 round; on subsequent rounds, they are dazzled as long as they remain in the affected area.

RacialTrait.Name: Weapon Familiarity
RacialTrait.Description: Drow are proficient with the hand crossbow, rapier, and short sword.

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Drow begin play speaking Elven and Undercommon. Drow with high Intelligence scores can choose from the following languages

RacialTrait.Name: Ambitious Schemer
RacialTrait.Description: Seduction and treachery are tools for advancement in drow society, even for the martially inclined. Drow with this racial trait may choose either Bluff or Diplomacy as a class skill, and gain a +2 bonus on such skill checks. This racial trait replaces kee

RacialTrait.Name: Ancestral Grudge
RacialTrait.Description: The enmity between the drow and elves and dwarves is long-standing and deeply entrenched. Drow with this racial trait gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls against humanoids with the dwarf or elf subtypes (with the exception of drow) because of their special tr

RacialTrait.Name: Blasphemous Covenant
RacialTrait.Description: Since their twisted beginnings, the drow have consorted with demons. Some drow have strong ties with these creatures and may call upon ancient and obscene associations to sway demonic cooperation. Drow with this racial trait gain a +2 bonus on Diplomacy c

RacialTrait.Name: Darklands Stalker
RacialTrait.Description: The lands outside of drow cities, from rough-hewn tunnels to rocky caverns, are treacherous to navigate. Drow with this racial trait may move through difficult terrain without penalty while underground. In addition, drow with a Dexterity of 13 or higher g

RacialTrait.Name: Seducer
RacialTrait.Description: Certain drow possess an innate understanding of the darkest desires that lurk in every heart. Drow with this racial trait add +1 to the saving throw DCs for spells and spell-like abilities of the enchantment school. In addition, drow with a Wisdom score o

RacialTrait.Name: Surface Infiltrator
RacialTrait.Description: Some drow dwell close to the surface lands, either because they serve drow causes or they were exiled. Drow with this racial trait gain low-light vision, allowing them to see twice as far as humans in conditions of dim light. This racial trait replaces th

RacialTrait.Name: Stats
RacialTrait.Description: Duergar are hearty and observant, but also belligerent. +2 Constitution, +2 Wisdom, –4 Charisma

RacialTrait.Name: Medium
RacialTrait.Description: Duergar are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

RacialTrait.Name: Dwarf
RacialTrait.Description: Duergar are humanoids with the dwarf subtype.

RacialTrait.Name: Slow and Steady
RacialTrait.Description: Duergar have a base speed of 20 feet, but their speed is never modified by armor or encumbrance.

RacialTrait.Name: Superior Darkvision
RacialTrait.Description: Duergar can see in the dark up to 120 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Duergar Immunities
RacialTrait.Description: Duergar are immune to paralysis, phantasms, and poison. They gain a +2 racial bonus on saves against spells and spell-like abilities.

RacialTrait.Name: Stability
RacialTrait.Description: Duergar receive a +4 racial bonus to their CMD against bull rush or trip attempts while on solid ground.

RacialTrait.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
RacialTrait.Description: A duergar can use enlarge person and invisibility once each per day, using its character level as its caster level and affecting itself only.

RacialTrait.Name: Light Sensitivity
RacialTrait.Description: Duergar are dazzled in areas of bright light.

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Duergar begin play speaking Common, Dwarven, and Undercommon. Duergar with high Intelligence scores can choose from the following

RacialTrait.Name: Blood Enmity
RacialTrait.Description: Duergar have long warred against their dwarven cousins and the hated drow. Duergar with this racial trait receive a +1 racial bonus on attack rolls against humanoid creatures of the dwarf or elf subtypes. This racial trait replaces the invisibility spell-

RacialTrait.Name: Daysighted
RacialTrait.Description: The cruel light of the sun harms some duergar less than others. Such duergar lack the light sensitivity racial trait, but have darkvision of only 60 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Deep Magic
RacialTrait.Description: Duergar spellcasters labor long to overcome the inborn spell resistance held by so many of their underground foes. Duergar with this racial trait receive a +2 racial bonus on caster level checks made to overcome spell resistance and a +2 racial bonus on d

RacialTrait.Name: Dwarf Traits
RacialTrait.Description: Duergar can select any dwarf racial trait that replaces stability. They can select dwarf racial traits that replace the hardy dwarf racial trait by giving up duergar immunities instead.

RacialTrait.Name: Stats
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves are both tough and wise, but also a bit gruff. They gain +2 Constitution, +2 Wisdom, and –2 Charisma.

RacialTrait.Name: Medium
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

RacialTrait.Name: Slow and Steady
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves have a base speed of 20 feet, but their speed is never modified by armor or encumbrance.

RacialTrait.Name: Darkvision
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Defensive Giant Training
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves get a +4 dodge bonus to AC against monsters of the giant subtype.

RacialTrait.Name: Greed
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves receive a +2 racial bonus on Appraise skill checks made to determine the price of nonmagical goods that contain precious metals or gemstones.

RacialTrait.Name: Hatred
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves receive a +1 bonus on attack rolls against humanoid creatures of the orc and goblinoid subtypes due to special training against these hated foes.

RacialTrait.Name: Hardy
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves receive a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against poison, spells, and spell-like abilities.

RacialTrait.Name: Stability
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves receive a +4 racial bonus to their Combat Maneuver Defense when resisting a bull rush or trip attempt while standing on the ground.

RacialTrait.Name: Stonecunning
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves receive a +2 bonus on Perception checks to potentially notice unusual stonework, such as traps and hidden doors located in stone walls or floors. They receive a check to notice such features whenever they pass within 10 feet of them, whether or no

RacialTrait.Name: Weapon Familiarity
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves are proficient with battleaxes, heavy picks, and warhammers, and treat any weapon with the word “dwarven” in its name as a martial weapon.

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves begin play speaking Common and Dwarven. Dwarves with high Intelligence scores can choose from the following

RacialTrait.Name: Ancient Enmity
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves have long been in conflict with elves, especially the hated drow. Dwarves with this racial trait receive a +1 racial bonus on attack rolls against humanoid creatures of the elf subtype. This racial trait replaces hatred.

RacialTrait.Name: Craftsman
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves are known for their superior craftsmanship when it comes to metallurgy and stonework. Dwarves with this racial trait receive a +2 racial bonus on all Craft or Profession checks related to metal or stone. This racial trait replaces greed.

RacialTrait.Name: Deep Warrior
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves with this racial trait grew up facing the abominations that live deep beneath the surface. They receive a +2 dodge bonus to AC against monsters of the aberration type and a +2 racial bonus on combat maneuver checks made to grapple such creatures (

RacialTrait.Name: Giant Hunter
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves with this racial trait gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls against humanoids with the giant subtype. Furthermore, they gain a +2 bonus on Survival checks to find and follow tracks made by humanoids with the giant subtype. This racial trait replaces th

RacialTrait.Name: Lorekeeper
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves keep extensive records about their history and the world around them. Dwarves with this racial trait receive a +2 racial bonus on Knowledge (history) checks that pertain to dwarves or their enemies. They can make such skill checks untrained. This

RacialTrait.Name: Magic Resistant
RacialTrait.Description: Some of the older dwarven clans are particularly resistant to magic. Dwarves with this racial trait gain spell resistance equal to 5 + their character level. This resistance can be lowered for 1 round as a standard action. Dwarves with this racial trait t

RacialTrait.Name: Minesight
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves with this racial trait increase the range of their darkvision to 90 feet; however, they are automatically dazzled in bright light and take a –2 penalty on saving throws against effects with the light descriptor. This racial trait replaces darkvisi

RacialTrait.Name: Mountaineer
RacialTrait.Description: Mountain dwarves are skilled at climbing and navigating narrow ledges. Dwarves with this racial trait are immune to altitude sickness and do not lose their Dexterity bonus to AC when making Climb or Acrobatics checks to cross narrow or slippery surfaces.

RacialTrait.Name: Relentless
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves are skilled at pushing their way through a battlefield, tossing aside lesser foes with ease. Dwarves with this racial trait receive a +2 bonus on combat maneuver checks made to bull rush or overrun an opponent. This bonus only applies while both t

RacialTrait.Name: Rock Stepper
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves with this racial trait can skillfully negotiate rocky terrain. They can ignore difficult terrain created by rubble, broken ground, or steep stairs when they take a 5-foot step. This racial trait replaces stonecunning.

RacialTrait.Name: Saltbeard
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves occasionally found iron cities along rugged seacoasts, and natives of such cities gain a +2 bonus on Profession (sailor) and Survival checks while at sea. They gain a +1 racial bonus on attack rolls and a +2 dodge bonus to AC against creatures wit

RacialTrait.Name: Sky Sentinel
RacialTrait.Description: As creatures with a deep affinity for the ground, dwarves are wary of attacks from above. Enemies on higher ground gain no attack roll bonus against dwarves with this racial trait, and they gain a +1 racial bonus on attack rolls, a +2 dodge bonus to AC, a

RacialTrait.Name: Stonesinger
RacialTrait.Description: Some dwarves' affinity for the earth grants them greater powers. Dwarves with this racial trait are treated as one level higher when casting spells with the earth descriptor or using granted powers of the Earth domain, the bloodline powers of the earth el

RacialTrait.Name: Stubborn
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves are renowned for their stubbornness. Dwarves with this racial trait receive a +2 racial bonus on Will saves to resist spells and spell-like abilities of the enchantment (charm) and enchantment (compulsion) schools. In addition, if they fail such a

RacialTrait.Name: Surface Survivalist
RacialTrait.Description: Some dwarves have dwelt so long aboveground they have lost their ability to see at night. However, their adaptation to extreme environments allows them to treat wind conditions (when determining whether or not they are checked or blown away) and either ho

RacialTrait.Name: Xenophobic
RacialTrait.Description: Isolationist dwarves despise non-dwarven humanoids. They speak only Dwarven and do not gain any bonus languages from possessing a high Intelligence score. In addition, they learn only one language per 2 ranks of Linguistics they possess. However, their un

RacialTrait.Name: Wyrmscourged
RacialTrait.Description: Dwarves with this racial trait gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls and a +2 dodge bonus to AC and on saving throws against the exceptional, supernatural, and spell-like abilities of dragons. They also gain a +2 racial bonus on Knowledge (arcana) checks to ide

RacialTrait.Name: Stats
RacialTrait.Description: +2 Dexterity, +2 Intelligence, –2 Constitution: Elves are nimble, both in body and mind, but their form is frail.

RacialTrait.Name: Medium
RacialTrait.Description: Elves are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

RacialTrait.Name: Normal Speed
RacialTrait.Description: Elves have a base speed of 30 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Low-Light Vision
RacialTrait.Description: Elves can see twice as far as humans in conditions of dim light. See Additional Rules.

RacialTrait.Name: Elven Immunities
RacialTrait.Description: Elves are immune to magic sleep effects and get a +2 racial saving throw bonus against enchantment spells and effects.

RacialTrait.Name: Elven Magic
RacialTrait.Description: Elves receive a +2 racial bonus on caster level checks made to overcome spell resistance. In addition, elves receive a +2 racial bonus on Spellcraft skill checks made to identify the properties of magic items.

RacialTrait.Name: Keen Senses
RacialTrait.Description: Elves receive a +2 racial bonus on Perception skill checks.

RacialTrait.Name: Weapon Familiarity
RacialTrait.Description: Elves are proficient with longbows (including composite longbows), longswords, rapiers, and shortbows (including composite shortbows), and treat any weapon with the word “elven” in its name as a martial weapon.

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Elves begin play speaking Common and Elven. Elves with high Intelligence scores can choose from the following

RacialTrait.Name: Arcane Focus
RacialTrait.Description: Some elven families have such long traditions of producing wizards (and other arcane spellcasters) that they raise their children with the assumption each is destined to be a powerful magic-user, with little need for mundane concerns such as skill with we

RacialTrait.Name: Darkvision
RacialTrait.Description: Though uncommon, some groups of elves are born with darkvision, rather than low-light vision. In many cases this is taken as a sign of a drow in the elf's ancestry, and can lead to persecution within the elf's home community. Elves with this racial trait

RacialTrait.Name: Desert Runner
RacialTrait.Description: Some elves thrive in the deepest deserts, forever roaming across burned and parched lands. Elves with this racial trait receive a +4 racial bonus on Constitution checks and Fortitude saves to avoid fatigue, exhaustion, or ill effects from running, forced

RacialTrait.Name: Dreamspeaker
RacialTrait.Description: A few elves have the ability to tap into the power of sleep, dreams, and prescient reverie. Elves with this racial trait add +1 to the saving throw DCs of spells of the divination school and sleep effects they cast. In addition, elves with Charisma scores

RacialTrait.Name: Elemental Resistance
RacialTrait.Description: Elves who dwell in the most extreme environments, from arctic wastelands to volcanic plains, develop natural resistance to the dangers of their homelands over the course of a few generations. Elves with this racial trait gain elemental resistance 5 to aci

RacialTrait.Name: Envoy
RacialTrait.Description: Elves often have trouble relating to neighbors of other races, especially those with much shorter lifespans. As a result, some are trained in minor magics that are particularly useful when dealing with non-elves. Elves with this racial trait and an Intell

RacialTrait.Name: Eternal Grudge
RacialTrait.Description: Some elves grow up in secluded, isolationist communities where generations-old slights and quarrels linger as eternal blood feuds. Elves with this racial trait receive a +1 bonus on attack rolls against humanoids of the dwarf and orc subtypes because of s

RacialTrait.Name: Fleet-Footed
RacialTrait.Description: While all elves are naturally lithe and agile, some also are naturally speedy and have a strong desire to rush into situations rather than worrying about looking ahead. Elves with this racial trait receive Run as a bonus feat and a +2 racial bonus on init

RacialTrait.Name: Lightbringer
RacialTrait.Description: Many elves revere the sun, moon, and stars, but some are literally infused with the radiant power of the heavens. Elves with this racial trait are immune to light-based blindness and dazzle effects, and are treated as one level higher when determining the

RacialTrait.Name: Silent Hunter
RacialTrait.Description: Elves are renowned for their subtlety and skill. Elves with this racial trait reduce the penalty for using Stealth while moving by 5 and can make Stealth checks while running at a –20 penalty (this number includes the penalty reduction from this racial tr

RacialTrait.Name: Spirit of the Waters
RacialTrait.Description: Some elves have adapted to life in tune with the sea or along the reedy depths of wild rivers and lakes. They gain a +4 racial bonus on Swim checks, can always take 10 while swimming, and may choose Aquan as a bonus language. They are proficient with long

RacialTrait.Name: Urbanite
RacialTrait.Description: Elves who live in cities for more than a century can grow to know the ebb and flow of social situations just as their forest-dwelling cousins know the rules of the wild. Elves with this racial trait gain a +2 racial bonus on Diplomacy checks made to gathe

RacialTrait.Name: Woodcraft
RacialTrait.Description: Elves know the deep secrets of the wild like no others, especially secrets of the forests. Elves with this racial trait gain a +1 racial bonus on Knowledge (nature) and Survival checks. In forest terrain, these bonuses improve to +2. This racial trait rep

RacialTrait.Name: Stats
RacialTrait.Description: +2 Dexterity, +2 Charisma, –2 Wisdom Fetchlings are quick and forceful, but often strange and easily distracted by errant thoughts.

RacialTrait.Name: Native Outsider
RacialTrait.Description: Fetchlings are outsiders with the native subtype.

RacialTrait.Name: Medium
RacialTrait.Description: Fetchlings are Medium creatures and receive no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

RacialTrait.Name: Normal Speed
RacialTrait.Description: Fetchlings have a base speed of 30 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Darkvision
RacialTrait.Description: Fetchlings can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Low-Light Vision
RacialTrait.Description: Fetchlings can see twice as far as humans in conditions of dim light.

RacialTrait.Name: Skilled
RacialTrait.Description: Fetchlings have a +2 racial bonus on Knowledge (planes) and Stealth checks.

RacialTrait.Name: Shadow Blending
RacialTrait.Description: Attacks against a fetchling in dim light have a 50% miss chance instead of the normal 20% miss chance. This ability does not grant total concealment; it just increases the miss chance.

RacialTrait.Name: Shadowy Resistance
RacialTrait.Description: Fetchlings have cold resistance 5 and electricity resistance 5.

RacialTrait.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
RacialTrait.Description: A fetchling can use disguise self once per day as a spell-like ability. He can assume the form of any humanoid creature using this spell-like ability. When a fetchling reaches 9th level in any combination of classes, he gains shadow walk (self only) as a

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Fetchlings begin play speaking Common. Fetchlings with a high Intelligence scores can choose from the following

RacialTrait.Name: Emissary
RacialTrait.Description: Rare fetchlings excel in the role of emissary between the Shadow Plane and the Material Plane. Once per day, such a fetchling can roll twice when making a Bluff or Diplomacy check and take the better roll. This racial trait replaces shadow blending.

RacialTrait.Name: Gloom Shimmer
RacialTrait.Description: Some fetchlings can manipulate shadowy energy in order to displace their location instead of transporting between shadows. Upon reaching 9th level, instead of gaining shadow walk as a spell-like ability, these fetchlings gain displacement as a spell-like

RacialTrait.Name: Shadow Magic
RacialTrait.Description: Fetchlings who spend their time studying the subtle magic of their adopted plane gain arcane insights on the use of shadow spells. These fetchlings gain a +1 racial bonus to the DC of any illusion (shadow) spells they cast. This racial trait replaces the

RacialTrait.Name: Subtle Manipulator
RacialTrait.Description: Rather than taking on the forms of others, some fetchling are adept at destroying the memories of other creatures. Instead of gaining disguise self as a spell-like ability, such fetchlings can use memory lapse once per day as a spell-like ability. For thi

RacialTrait.Name: World Walker
RacialTrait.Description: Fetchlings who have spent most of their lives on the Material Plane can become more acclimated to their new environments. Instead of gaining a +2 racial bonus on Knowledge (planes) checks, these fetchlings gain a +1 racial bonus on Knowledge (nature) and

RacialTrait.Name: Stats
RacialTrait.Description: Gillmen are vigorous and beautiful, but their domination by the aboleths has made them weak-willed. +2 Constitution, +2 Charisma, –2 Wisdom

RacialTrait.Name: Medium
RacialTrait.Description: Gillmen are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

RacialTrait.Name: Aquatic
RacialTrait.Description: Gillmen are humanoids with the aquatic subtype.

RacialTrait.Name: Normal Speed
RacialTrait.Description: Gillmen have a base speed of 30 feet on land. As aquatic creatures, they also have a swim speed of 30 feet, can move in water without making Swim checks, and always treat Swim as a class skill.

RacialTrait.Name: Amphibious
RacialTrait.Description: Gillmen have the aquatic subtype, but can breathe both water and air.

RacialTrait.Name: Enchantment Resistance
RacialTrait.Description: Gillmen gain a +2 racial saving throw bonus against non-aboleth enchantment spells and effects, but take a –2 penalty on such saving throws against aboleth sources.

RacialTrait.Name: Water Dependent
RacialTrait.Description: A gillman's body requires constant submersion in fresh or salt water. Gillmen who spend more than 1 day without fully submerging themselves in water risk internal organ failure, painful cracking of the skin, and death within 4d6 hours.

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Gillmen begin play speaking Common and Aboleth. Gillmen with high Intelligence scores can choose from the following

RacialTrait.Name: Riverfolk
RacialTrait.Description: Some gillmen groups live in colonies along vast riverways, and have adapted to living on land for much longer periods. Gillmen with this trait have a thin coating of natural oil that keeps their skin from cracking even without water. However, this natural

RacialTrait.Name: Slimehunter
RacialTrait.Description: Gillmen with this trait are from lineages that have fought against aboleths since the aberrations rescued their human ancestors. They receive a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against aboleth spells, spell-like abilities, and supernatural abilities. This

RacialTrait.Name: Throwback
RacialTrait.Description: Some gillmen are throwbacks to their land-dwelling human ancestors. Gillmen with this racial trait do not have the amphibious trait, have the human subtype instead of the aquatic subtype, have no swim speed or bonuses to the Swim skill, cannot breathe wat

RacialTrait.Name: Stats
RacialTrait.Description: Gnomes are physically weak but surprisingly hardy, and their attitude makes them naturally agreeable.

RacialTrait.Name: Small
RacialTrait.Description: Gnomes are Small creatures and gain a +1 size bonus to their AC, a +1 size bonus on attack rolls, a –1 penalty to their Combat Maneuver Bonus and Combat Maneuver Defense, and a +4 size bonus on Stealth checks.

RacialTrait.Name: Slow Speed
RacialTrait.Description: Gnomes have a base speed of 20 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Low-Light Vision
RacialTrait.Description: Gnomes can see twice as far as humans in conditions of dim light. See Additional Rules.

RacialTrait.Name: Defensive Giant Training
RacialTrait.Description: Gnomes get a +4 dodge bonus to AC against monsters of the giant type.

RacialTrait.Name: Gnome Magic
RacialTrait.Description: Gnomes add +1 to the DC of any saving throws against illusion spells that they cast. Gnomes with a Charisma of 11 or higher also gain the following spell-like abilities

RacialTrait.Name: Hatred
RacialTrait.Description: Gnomes receive a +1 bonus on attack rolls against humanoid creatures of the reptilian and goblinoid subtypes due to special training against these hated foes.

RacialTrait.Name: Illusion Resistance
RacialTrait.Description: Gnomes get a +2 racial saving throw bonus against illusion spells or effects.

RacialTrait.Name: Keen Senses
RacialTrait.Description: Gnomes receive a +2 racial bonus on Perception skill checks.

RacialTrait.Name: Obsessive
RacialTrait.Description: Gnomes receive a +2 racial bonus on a Craft or Profession skill of their choice.

RacialTrait.Name: Weapon Familiarity
RacialTrait.Description: Gnomes treat any weapon with the word “gnome” in its name as a martial weapon.

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Gnomes begin play speaking Common, Gnome, and Sylvan. Gnomes with high Intelligence scores can choose from the following

RacialTrait.Name: Academician
RacialTrait.Description: Some gnomes are more academically inclined than their kin. Gnomes with this racial trait gain a +2 bonus on any single Knowledge skill. This racial trait replaces the obsessive racial trait.

RacialTrait.Name: Bond to the Land
RacialTrait.Description: Some gnomes have strong ties to specific kinds of terrain, as a holdover from their fey origins. These gnomes gain a +2 dodge bonus to AC when in a specific terrain type selected from the ranger list of favored terrains. This choice is made at character c

RacialTrait.Name: Darkvision
RacialTrait.Description: Some gnome strains have lived in the underground depths for so long they have given up on light entirely and gained darkvision with a range of 60 feet. This racial trait replaces low-light vision and keen senses.

RacialTrait.Name: Eternal Hope
RacialTrait.Description: Gnomes rarely lose hope and are always confident that even hopeless situations will work out. Gnomes with this racial trait receive a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against fear and despair effects. Once per day, after rolling a 1 on a d20, the gnome ma

RacialTrait.Name: Explorer
RacialTrait.Description: Many gnomes are obsessed with seeing as much of the world as possible, rather than perfecting some specific talent or vocation. These gnomes gain a +2 racial bonus on Climb checks and checks for one Knowledge skill of their choice. This racial trait repla

RacialTrait.Name: Fell Magic
RacialTrait.Description: Gnomes add +1 to the DC of any saving throws against necromancy spells that they cast. Gnomes with Wisdom scores of 11 or higher also gain the following spell-like abilities

RacialTrait.Name: Gift of Tongues
RacialTrait.Description: Gnomes love languages and learning about those they meet. Gnomes with this racial trait gain a +1 bonus on Bluff and Diplomacy checks, and they learn one additional language every time they put a rank in the Linguistics skill. This racial trait replaces d

RacialTrait.Name: Knack with Poison
RacialTrait.Description: Some gnomes have an instinctive understanding of poisons and their uses. Gnomes gain a +2 racial bonus on Fortitude saves against poison and a +2 bonus on Craft (alchemy) checks to make poison. The bonus on Fortitude saving throws against poisons increase

RacialTrait.Name: Magical Linguist
RacialTrait.Description: Gnomes study languages in both their mundane and supernatural manifestations. Gnomes with this racial trait add +1 to the DC of spells they cast with the language-dependent descriptor or those that create glyphs, symbols, or other magical writings. They g

RacialTrait.Name: Master Tinker
RacialTrait.Description: Gnomes experiment with all manner of mechanical devices. Gnomes with this racial trait gain a +1 bonus on Disable Device and Knowledge (engineering) checks. They are treated as proficient with any weapon they have personally crafted. This racial trait rep

RacialTrait.Name: Pyromaniac
RacialTrait.Description: Gnomes with this racial trait are treated as one level higher when casting spells with the fire descriptor, using granted powers of the Fire domain, using the bloodline powers of the fire elemental bloodline or the revelations of the oracle's flame myster

RacialTrait.Name: Warden of Nature
RacialTrait.Description: Gnomes must often protect their homes against unnatural or pestilential infestations. Gnomes with this racial trait gain a +2 dodge bonus to AC against aberrations, oozes, and vermin, and a +1 bonus on attack rolls against them because of their special tr

RacialTrait.Name: Stats
RacialTrait.Description: +4 Dexterity, –2 Strength, –2 Charisma Goblins are fast, but weak and unpleasant to be around.

RacialTrait.Name: Goblinoid
RacialTrait.Description: Goblins are humanoids with the goblinoid subtype.

RacialTrait.Name: Small
RacialTrait.Description: Goblins are Small creatures and gain a +1 size bonus to their AC, a +1 size bonus on attack rolls, a –1 penalty to their CMB and CMD, and a +4 size bonus on Stealth checks.

RacialTrait.Name: Fast
RacialTrait.Description: Goblins are fast for their size, and have a base speed of 30 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Darkvision
RacialTrait.Description: Goblins can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Skilled
RacialTrait.Description: +4 racial bonus on Ride and Stealth checks.

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Goblins begin play speaking Goblin. Goblins with high Intelligence scores can choose from the following

RacialTrait.Name: Cave Crawler
RacialTrait.Description: Some goblins are born and raised in caves and rarely see the light of day. Goblins with this trait gain a climb speed of 10 feet and the +8 racial bonus on Climb checks associated with having a climb speed. Goblins with this racial trait have a base speed

RacialTrait.Name: City Scavenger
RacialTrait.Description: Goblins who live within the boundaries of human cities survive by scavenging for refuse and hunting stray animals. Goblins with this trait gain a +2 racial bonus on Perception and Survival checks, and can use Survival to forage for food while in a city. T

RacialTrait.Name: Eat Anything
RacialTrait.Description: Raised with little or no proper food, many goblins have learned to survive by eating whatever they happen across and can digest nearly anything without getting sick. Goblins with this trait gain a +4 on Survival checks to forage for food and a +4 racial b

RacialTrait.Name: Hard Head, Big Teeth
RacialTrait.Description: Goblins are known for their balloonlike heads and enormous maws, but some have even more exaggeratedly large heads filled with razor-sharp teeth. Goblins with this trait gain a bite attack as a primary natural attack that deals 1d4 points of damage. This

RacialTrait.Name: Over-Sized Ears
RacialTrait.Description: While goblins' ears are never dainty, these goblins have freakishly large ears capable of picking up even the smallest sounds. Goblins with this racial trait gain a +4 bonus on Perception checks. This racial trait replaces skilled.

RacialTrait.Name: Tree Runner
RacialTrait.Description: In trackless rain forests and marshes, it can be difficult to find dry ground to build on. Goblin tribes living in such areas have learned to live in the treetops. These goblins gain a +4 racial bonus on Acrobatics and Climb checks. This racial trait repl

RacialTrait.Name: Weapon Familiarity
RacialTrait.Description: Goblins' traditional weapons are the dogslicer and the horsechopper, weapons designed specifically to bring down their most hated foes. Goblins with this trait are proficient with the dogslicer and the horsechopper, and treat any weapon with the word gobl

RacialTrait.Name: Green Widow
RacialTrait.Description: The changeling gains a +2 racial bonus on Bluff checks against creatures that are sexually attracted to her.

RacialTrait.Name: Stats
RacialTrait.Description: Gripplis are nimble and alert, but spindly. +2 Dexterity, +2 Wisdom, –2 Strength

RacialTrait.Name: Small
RacialTrait.Description: Gripplis are Small creatures and gain a +1 size bonus to their AC, a +1 size bonus on attack rolls, a –1 penalty to their CMB and CMD, and a +4 size bonus on Stealth checks.

RacialTrait.Name: Grippli
RacialTrait.Description: Gripplis are humanoids with the grippli subtype.

RacialTrait.Name: Normal Speed
RacialTrait.Description: Gripplis have a base speed of 30 feet and a climb speed of 20 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Darkvision
RacialTrait.Description: Gripplis can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Camouflage
RacialTrait.Description: Gripplis receive a +4 racial bonus on Stealth checks in marshes and forested areas.

RacialTrait.Name: Swamp Stride
RacialTrait.Description: A grippli can move through difficult terrain at its normal speed while within a swamp. Magically altered terrain affects a grippli normally.

RacialTrait.Name: Weapon Familiarity
RacialTrait.Description: Gripplis are proficient with nets.

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Gripplis begin play speaking Common and Grippli. Gripplis with high Intelligence scores can choose from the following

RacialTrait.Name: Glider
RacialTrait.Description: Gripplis' aerodynamic bodies and thick webbing between the toes enable a falling grippli to treat the distance fallen as half the actual distance. The grippli can steer himself while falling, moving horizontally up to a number of feet equal to half the ve

RacialTrait.Name: Jumper
RacialTrait.Description: Gripplis with this trait are always considered to have a running start when making Acrobatics checks to jump. This racial trait replaces camouflage.

RacialTrait.Name: Princely
RacialTrait.Description: The grippli gains proficiency with rapiers and a +2 racial bonus on Diplomacy and Intimidate checks. This racial trait replaces swamp stride and weapon familiarity.

RacialTrait.Name: Toxic Skin
RacialTrait.Description: Once per day as a swift action, a grippli can create a poison that can be applied to a weapon or delivered as a touch attack. Alternatively, the grippli can smear the poison on its own body as a standard action, affecting the first creature to hit it with

RacialTrait.Name: Stat Choice
RacialTrait.Description: Half-elf characters get a +2 bonus to one ability score of their choice at creation to represent their varied nature.

RacialTrait.Name: Medium
RacialTrait.Description: Half-elves are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

RacialTrait.Name: Normal Speed
RacialTrait.Description: Half-elves have a base speed of 30 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Low-Light Vision
RacialTrait.Description: Half-elves can see twice as far as humans in conditions of dim light. See Additional Rules.

RacialTrait.Name: Adaptability
RacialTrait.Description: Half-elves receive Skill Focus as a bonus feat at 1st level.

RacialTrait.Name: Elf Blood
RacialTrait.Description: Half-elves count as both elves and humans for any effect related to race.

RacialTrait.Name: Elven Immunities
RacialTrait.Description: Half-elves are immune to magic sleep effects and get a +2 racial saving throw bonus against enchantment spells and effects.

RacialTrait.Name: Keen Senses
RacialTrait.Description: Half-elves receive a +2 racial bonus on Perception skill checks.

RacialTrait.Name: Multitalented
RacialTrait.Description: Half-elves choose two favored classes at first level and gain +1 hit point or +1 skill point whenever they take a level in either one of those classes. See Classes for more information about favored classes.

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Half-elves begin play speaking Common and Elven. Half-elves with high Intelligence scores can choose any languages they want (except secret languages, such as Druidic).

RacialTrait.Name: Ancestral Arms
RacialTrait.Description: Some half-elves receive training in an unusual weapon. Half-elves with this racial trait receive Exotic Weapon Proficiency or Martial Weapon Proficiency with one weapon as a bonus feat at 1st level. This racial trait replaces the adaptability racial trait

RacialTrait.Name: Arcane Training
RacialTrait.Description: Half-elves occasionally seek tutoring to help them master the magic in their blood. Half-elves with this racial trait have only one favored class, and it must be an arcane spellcasting class. They can use spell trigger and spell completion items for their

RacialTrait.Name: Drow-Blooded
RacialTrait.Description: Some half-elves born of drow parents exhibit more drow traits than others—particularly many of the physical features of the drow—and have darkvision 60 feet and light blindness. This racial trait replaces the low-light vision racial trait.

RacialTrait.Name: Drow Magic
RacialTrait.Description: A few half-elves with drow ancestry exhibit the innate magic of that race. Half-elves with this trait have drow blood somewhere in their background, and can cast dancing lights, darkness, and faerie fire each once per day, using the half-elf's character l

RacialTrait.Name: Dual Minded
RacialTrait.Description: The mixed ancestry of some half-elves makes them resistant to mental attacks. Half-elves with this racial trait gain a +2 bonus on all Will saving throws. This racial trait replaces the adaptability racial trait.

RacialTrait.Name: Integrated
RacialTrait.Description: Many half-elves are skilled in the art of ingratiating themselves into a community as if they were natives. Half-elves with this racial trait gain a +1 bonus on Bluff, Disguise, and Knowledge (local) checks. This racial trait replaces the adaptability rac

RacialTrait.Name: Sociable
RacialTrait.Description: Half-elves are skilled at charming others and recovering from faux pas. If half-elves with this racial trait attempt to change a creature's attitude with a Diplomacy check and fail by 5 or more, they can try to influence the creature a second time even if

RacialTrait.Name: Stats
RacialTrait.Description: Aasimars are insightful, confident, and personable, +2 Wisdom, +2 Charisma.

RacialTrait.Name: Native Outsider
RacialTrait.Description: Aasimars are outsiders with the native subtype.

RacialTrait.Name: Medium
RacialTrait.Description: Aasimars are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

RacialTrait.Name: Normal Speed
RacialTrait.Description: Aasimars have a base speed of 30 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Darkvision
RacialTrait.Description: Aasimars can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Skilled
RacialTrait.Description: Aasimars have a +2 racial bonus on Diplomacy and Perception checks.

RacialTrait.Name: Spell-Like Ability
RacialTrait.Description: Aasimars can use daylight once per day as a spell-like ability (caster level equal to the aasimar's class level).

RacialTrait.Name: Celestial Resistance
RacialTrait.Description: Aasimars have acid resistance 5, cold resistance 5, and electricity resistance 5.

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Aasimars begin play speaking Common and Celestial. Aasimars with high Intelligence scores can choose from the following languages

RacialTrait.Name: Celestial Crusader
RacialTrait.Description: Some aasimars follow their destiny to war against the powers of ultimate evil. These individuals gain a +1 insight bonus on attack rolls and to AC against evil outsiders and a +2 racial bonus on Knowledge (planes) and Spellcraft checks to identify evil outsiders or items or effects created by evil outsiders; they may use these skills untrained for this purpose. This racial trait replaces celestial resistance and skilled.

RacialTrait.Name: Deathless Spirit
RacialTrait.Description: Particularly strong-willed aasimars possess celestial spirits capable of resisting the powers of death. They gain resistance 5 against negative energy damage. They do not lose hit points when they gain a negative level, and they gain a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against death effects, energy drain, negative energy, and spells or spell-like abilities of the necromancy school. This racial trait replaces celestial resistance.

RacialTrait.Name: Exalted Resistance
RacialTrait.Description: An aasimar with this racial trait gains spell resistance equal to 5 + her level against spells and spell-like abilities with the evil descriptor, as well as any spells and spell-like abilities cast by evil outsiders. This racial trait replaces celestial resistance.

RacialTrait.Name: Halo
RacialTrait.Description: Some aasimars possess the ability to manifest halos. An aasimar with this racial trait can create light centered on her head at will as a spell-like ability. When using her halo, she gains a +2 circumstance bonus on Intimidate checks against evil creatures and on saving throws against becoming blinded or dazzled. This racial trait replaces the darkvision racial trait.

RacialTrait.Name: Heavenborn
RacialTrait.Description: Born in the celestial realms, aasimars with this racial trait gain a +2 bonus on Knowledge (planes) checks and they cast spells with the good or light descriptor at +1 caster level. This racial trait replaces the skilled and spell-like ability racial traits.

RacialTrait.Name: Immortal Spark
RacialTrait.Description: Aasimars with this racial trait defy the powers of death. They gain a +2 bonus on Knowledge (history) checks and saving throws against death effects and can use lesser age resistance once per day as a spell-like ability. This racial trait replaces the skilled and spell-like ability racial traits.

RacialTrait.Name: Incorruptible
RacialTrait.Description: Occasionally, aasimars arise with the ability to further ward away evil. Aasimars with this racial trait can cast corruption resistance against evil once per day as a spell-like ability. If an aasimar uses this ability on herself, the duration increases to 1 hour per level. This racial trait replaces the spell-like ability racial trait.

RacialTrait.Name: Scion of Humanity
RacialTrait.Description: Some aasimars' heavenly ancestry is extremely distant. An aasimar with this racial trait counts as an outsider (native) and a humanoid (human) for any effect related to race, including feat prerequisites and spells that affect humanoids. She can pass for human without using the Disguise skill. This racial trait replaces the Celestial language and alters the native subtype.

RacialTrait.Name: Truespeaker
RacialTrait.Description: There are some aasimars whose language transcends all boundaries. They gain a +2 bonus on Linguistics and Sense Motive checks, and they learn two languages each time they gain a rank in Linguistics. This racial trait replaces skilled.

RacialTrait.Name: Hulking Changeling
RacialTrait.Description: The changeling gains a +1 racial bonus on melee damage.

RacialTrait.Name: Stats
RacialTrait.Description: +2 Dexterity, +2 Charisma, –2 Wisdom Catfolk are sociable and agile, but often lack common sense.

RacialTrait.Name: Catfolk
RacialTrait.Description: Catfolk are humanoids with the catfolk subtype.

RacialTrait.Name: Medium
RacialTrait.Description: Catfolk are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

RacialTrait.Name: Normal Speed
RacialTrait.Description: Catfolk have a base speed of 30 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Low-Light Vision
RacialTrait.Description: In dim light, catfolk can see twice as far as humans.

RacialTrait.Name: Cat's Luck
RacialTrait.Description: Once per day when a catfolk makes a Reflex saving throw, he can roll the saving throw twice and take the better result. He must decide to use this ability before the saving throw is attempted.

RacialTrait.Name: Natural Hunter
RacialTrait.Description: Catfolk receive a +2 racial bonus on Perception, Stealth, and Survival checks.

RacialTrait.Name: Sprinter
RacialTrait.Description: Catfolk gain a 10-foot racial bonus to their speed when using the charge, run, or withdraw actions.

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Catfolk begin play speaking Common and Catfolk. Catfolk with high Intelligence scores can choose from the following languages

RacialTrait.Name: Cat's Claws
RacialTrait.Description: Some catfolk have stronger and more developed claws than other members of their race, and can use them to make attacks. Catfolk with this racial trait have a pair of claws they can use as natural weapons. These claws are primary attacks that deal 1d4 points of damage. This racial trait replaces natural hunter.

RacialTrait.Name: Clever Cat
RacialTrait.Description: Catfolk's generally friendly disposition doesn't preclude craftiness. Some of them see social obstacles as games to be played and won. These catfolk receive a +2 racial bonus on Bluff, Diplomacy, and Sense Motive checks. This racial trait replaces natural hunter.

RacialTrait.Name: Climber
RacialTrait.Description: Catfolk hunters excel at hunting prey from trees and other high vantage points. Catfolk with this racial trait possess a climb speed of 20 feet (along with the +8 racial bonus on Climb checks a climb speed affords). This racial trait replaces sprinter.

RacialTrait.Name: Curiosity
RacialTrait.Description: Catfolk are naturally inquisitive about the world around them, though some are more curious than others. Such catfolk gain a +4 bonus on Diplomacy checks to gather information, and Knowledge (history) and Knowledge (local) are always class skills for them. If they choose a class that has either of these Knowledge skills as class skills, they gain a +2 racial bonus on those skills instead. This racial trait replaces natural hunter.

RacialTrait.Name: Nimble Faller
RacialTrait.Description: Some catfolk have an amazing sense of balance and keen knowledge of their own center of gravity. Catfolk with this trait land on their feet even when they take lethal damage from a fall. Furthermore, catfolk with this trait gain a +1 bonus to their CMD against trip maneuvers. This racial trait replaces sprinter.

RacialTrait.Name: Scent
RacialTrait.Description: Some catfolk favor a keen sense of smell over sensitive sight. Catfolk with this racial trait gain the scent ability. This racial trait replaces the low-light vision racial trait.

RacialTrait.Name: Stats
RacialTrait.Description: Changelings are frail, but are clever and comely. Stats +2 Wisdom, +2 Charisma, –2 Constitution

RacialTrait.Name: Medium
RacialTrait.Description: Changelings are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

RacialTrait.Name: Changeling
RacialTrait.Description: Changelings are humanoids with the changeling subtype.

RacialTrait.Name: Normal Speed
RacialTrait.Description: Changelings have a base speed of 30 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Hag Racial Trait
RacialTrait.Description: The changeling inherits one of the following racial traits, depending on her mother's hag type

RacialTrait.Name: Claws
RacialTrait.Description: Changelings' fingernails are hard and sharp, granting them two claw attacks (1d4 points of damage each).

RacialTrait.Name: Natural Armor
RacialTrait.Description: Changelings have a +1 natural armor bonus.

RacialTrait.Name: Darkvision
RacialTrait.Description: Changelings can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Changelings begin play speaking Common and the primary language of their host society. Changelings with high Intelligence scores can choose from the following

RacialTrait.Name: Mist Child
RacialTrait.Description: When the changeling has concealment or total concealment, the miss chance of attacks against her increases by 5%. This racial trait replaces hulking changeling.

RacialTrait.Name: Wary
RacialTrait.Description: Many half-elves have spent their long lives moving from place to place, often driven out by the hostility of others. Such experiences have made them wary of others' motivations. Half-elves with this trait gain a +1 racial bonus on Sense Motive and Bluff c

RacialTrait.Name: Water Child
RacialTrait.Description: Some half-elves are born of elves adapted to life on or near the water. These half-elves gain a +4 racial bonus on Swim checks, can always take 10 while swimming, and may choose Aquan as a bonus language. This racial trait replaces the adaptability and mu

RacialTrait.Name: Stats
RacialTrait.Description: Halflings are nimble and strong-willed, but their small stature makes them weaker than other races. They gain +2 Dexterity, +2 Charisma, and –2 Strength.

RacialTrait.Name: Small
RacialTrait.Description: Halflings are Small creatures and gain a +1 size bonus to their AC, a +1 size bonus on attack rolls, a –1 penalty to their Combat Maneuver Bonus and Combat Maneuver Defense, and a +4 size bonus on Stealth checks.

RacialTrait.Name: Magic Haters
RacialTrait.Description: +2 racial bonus on saving throws against spells and spell-­like effects. Note: this stacks with Halfling Luck

RacialTrait.Name: Feral
RacialTrait.Description: Halflings receive a –2 penalty to all Diplomacy skill checks when dealing with other races. Halflings have a reputation for cannibalism and disdain for settled societies.

RacialTrait.Name: Slow Speed
RacialTrait.Description: Halflings have a base speed of 20 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Fearless
RacialTrait.Description: Halflings receive a +2 racial bonus on all saving throws against fear. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by halfling luck.

RacialTrait.Name: Halfling Luck
RacialTrait.Description: Halflings receive a +1 racial bonus on all saving throws.

RacialTrait.Name: Keen Senses
RacialTrait.Description: Halflings receive a +2 racial bonus on Perception skill checks.

RacialTrait.Name: Sure-Footed
RacialTrait.Description: Halflings receive a +2 racial bonus on Acrobatics and Climb skill checks.

RacialTrait.Name: Weapon Familiarity
RacialTrait.Description: Halflings are proficient with slings and treat any weapon with the word “halfling” in its name as a martial weapon.

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Halflings begin play speaking Common and Halfling. Halflings with high Intelligence scores can choose from the following

RacialTrait.Name: Adaptable Luck
RacialTrait.Description: Some halflings have greater control over their innate luck. This ability gives them more options for how they can apply their good fortune from day to day, but also narrows its scope. Three times per day, a halfling can gain a +2 luck bonus on an ability

RacialTrait.Name: Craven
RacialTrait.Description: While most halflings are fearless, some are skittish, making them particularly alert. Halflings with this racial trait gain a +1 bonus on initiative checks and a +1 bonus on attack rolls when flanking. They take a –2 penalty on saves against fear effects

RacialTrait.Name: Fleet of Foot
RacialTrait.Description: Some halflings are quicker than their kin but less cautious. Halflings with this racial trait move at normal speed and have a base speed of 30 feet. This racial trait replaces slow speed and sure-footed.

RacialTrait.Name: Ingratiating
RacialTrait.Description: Halflings often survive at the whims of larger, more aggressive races. Because of this, they go out of their way to make themselves more useful, or at least entertaining, to larger folk. Halflings with this racial trait gain a +2 bonus on skill checks for

RacialTrait.Name: Low Blow
RacialTrait.Description: Some halflings train extensively in the art of attacking larger creatures. Halflings with this racial trait gain a +1 bonus on critical confirmation rolls against opponents larger than themselves. This racial trait replaces keen senses.

RacialTrait.Name: Outrider
RacialTrait.Description: Some halflings specialize in mounted combat. Halflings with this racial trait gain a +2 bonus on Handle Animal and Ride checks. This racial trait replaces sure-footed.

RacialTrait.Name: Polyglot
RacialTrait.Description: Some halflings, especially those who spend a lot of time traveling, develop a talent for learning new languages. These halflings gain a +2 racial bonus on Linguistics checks, and it is always a class skill for them. Halflings with this racial trait also b

RacialTrait.Name: Practicality
RacialTrait.Description: Halflings value hard work and common sense. Halflings with this racial trait gain a +2 bonus on any one Craft or Profession skill, as well as on Sense Motive checks and saves against illusions. This racial trait replaces fearless and sure-footed.

RacialTrait.Name: Shiftless
RacialTrait.Description: Halflings have a reputation for larceny and guile—and sometimes it's well deserved. Halflings with this racial trait gain a +2 racial bonus on Bluff and Sleight of Hand checks, and Sleight of Hand is always a class skill for them. This racial trait replac

RacialTrait.Name: Swift as Shadows
RacialTrait.Description: Halflings possess incredible stealth even while moving through obstructed areas. Halflings with this racial trait reduce the penalty for using Stealth while moving by 5, and reduce the Stealth check penalty for sniping by 10. This racial trait replaces su

RacialTrait.Name: Underfoot
RacialTrait.Description: Halflings must train hard to effectively fight bigger opponents. Halflings with this racial trait gain a +1 dodge bonus to AC against foes larger than themselves and a +1 bonus on Reflex saving throws to avoid trample attacks. This racial trait replaces h

RacialTrait.Name: Wanderlust
RacialTrait.Description: Halflings love travel and maps. Halflings with this racial trait receive a +2 bonus on Knowledge (geography) and Survival checks. When casting spells or using abilities that provide or enhance movement, halflings treat their caster level as +1 higher than

RacialTrait.Name: Warslinger
RacialTrait.Description: Halflings are experts at the use of the sling. Halflings with this racial trait can reload a sling as a free action. Reloading a sling still requires two hands and provokes attacks of opportunity. This racial trait replaces sure-footed.

RacialTrait.Name: Stat Choice
RacialTrait.Description: Half-orc characters get a +2 bonus to one ability score of their choice at creation to represent their varied nature.

RacialTrait.Name: Medium
RacialTrait.Description: Half-orcs are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

RacialTrait.Name: Normal Speed
RacialTrait.Description: Half-orcs have a base speed of 30 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Darkvision
RacialTrait.Description: Half-orcs can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Intimidating
RacialTrait.Description: Half-orcs receive a +2 racial bonus on Intimidate skill checks due to their fearsome nature.

RacialTrait.Name: Orc Blood
RacialTrait.Description: Half-orcs count as both humans and orcs for any effect related to race.

RacialTrait.Name: Orc Ferocity
RacialTrait.Description: Once per day, when a half-orc is brought below 0 hit points but not killed, he can fight on for one more round as if disabled. At the end of his next turn, unless brought to above 0 hit points, he immediately falls unconscious and begins dying.

RacialTrait.Name: Weapon Familiarity
RacialTrait.Description: Half-orcs are proficient with greataxes and falchions and treat any weapon with the word “orc” in its name as a martial weapon.

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Half-orcs begin play speaking Common and Orc. Half-orcs with high Intelligence scores can choose from the following

RacialTrait.Name: Acute Darkvision
RacialTrait.Description: Some half-orcs have exceptionally sharp darkvision, gaining darkvision 90 feet. This racial trait replaces orc ferocity.

RacialTrait.Name: Beastmaster
RacialTrait.Description: Some half-orcs have a spiritual kinship with fantastical beasts, capturing them for sport or living and hunting with them. A half-orc with this trait treats whips and nets as martial weapons and gains a +2 racial bonus on Handle Animal checks. This racial

RacialTrait.Name: Bestial
RacialTrait.Description: The orc blood of some half-orcs manifests in the form of particularly prominent orc features, exacerbating their bestial appearances but improving their already keen senses. They gain a +2 racial bonus on Perception checks. This racial trait replaces orc

RacialTrait.Name: Cavewight
RacialTrait.Description: Some half-orcs live far below the surface, seeking freedom in winding cave complexes. Half-orcs with this racial trait gain a +1 racial bonus on Knowledge (dungeoneering) and Survival checks made underground. This racial trait replaces the intimidating tr

RacialTrait.Name: Chain Fighter
RacialTrait.Description: Some half-orcs have escaped from slavery and reforged the chains of their imprisonment into deadly weapons. Half-orcs with this racial trait are proficient with flails and heavy flails, and treat dire flails and spiked chains as martial weapons. This raci

RacialTrait.Name: City-Raised
RacialTrait.Description: Half-orcs with this trait know little of their orc ancestry and were raised among humans and other half-orcs in a large city. City-raised half-orcs are proficient with whips and longswords, and receive a +2 racial bonus on Knowledge (local) checks. This r

RacialTrait.Name: Forest Walker
RacialTrait.Description: More at home in the forests and jungles of the world, these half-orcs are well adapted to their surroundings. Half-orcs with this trait have low-light vision and gain a +2 racial bonus on Climb checks. This racial trait replaces darkvision.

RacialTrait.Name: Gatecrasher
RacialTrait.Description: Many half-orcs revel in acts of wanton destruction. Half-orcs with this racial trait gain a +2 racial bonus on Strength checks to break objects and on sunder combat maneuver checks. This racial trait replaces orc ferocity.

RacialTrait.Name: Rock Climber
RacialTrait.Description: Half-orcs from mountainous regions are excellent climbers, and sometimes ambush prey by leaping down from above. Half-orcs with this racial trait gain a +1 racial bonus on Acrobatics and Climb checks. This racial trait replaces the intimidating trait.

RacialTrait.Name: Sacred Tattoo
RacialTrait.Description: Many half-orcs decorate themselves with tattoos, piercings, and ritual scarification, which they consider sacred markings. Half-orcs with this racial trait gain a +1 luck bonus on all saving throws. This racial trait replaces orc ferocity.

RacialTrait.Name: Scavenger
RacialTrait.Description: Some half-orcs eke out a leaving picking over the garbage heaps of society, and must learn to separate rare finds from the inevitable dross. Half-orcs with this racial trait receive a +2 racial bonus on Appraise checks and on Perception checks to find hid

RacialTrait.Name: Shaman's Apprentice
RacialTrait.Description: Only the most stalwart survive the years of harsh treatment that an apprenticeship to an orc shaman entails. Half-orcs with this trait gain Endurance as a bonus feat. This racial trait replaces the intimidating trait.

RacialTrait.Name: Skilled
RacialTrait.Description: Second- and third-generation half-orcs often favor their human heritage more than their orc heritage. Half-orcs with this trait gain 1 additional skill rank per level. This racial trait replaces darkvision.

RacialTrait.Name: Toothy
RacialTrait.Description: Some half-orcs' tusks are large and sharp, granting a bite attack. This is a primary natural attack that deals 1d4 points of piercing damage. This racial trait replaces orc ferocity.

RacialTrait.Name: Stats
RacialTrait.Description: +2 Dexterity, +2 Constitution Hobgoblins are fast and hardy.

RacialTrait.Name: Goblinoid
RacialTrait.Description: Hobgoblins are humanoids with the goblinoid subtype.

RacialTrait.Name: Medium
RacialTrait.Description: Hobgoblins are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

RacialTrait.Name: Normal Speed
RacialTrait.Description: Hobgoblins have a base speed of 30 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Darkvision
RacialTrait.Description: Hobgoblins can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Sneaky
RacialTrait.Description: Hobgoblins receive a +4 racial bonus on Stealth checks.

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Hobgoblins begin play speaking Common and Goblin. Hobgoblins with high Intelligence scores can choose from the following

RacialTrait.Name: Bandy-Legged
RacialTrait.Description: Bandy-legged hobgoblins have an even more exaggerated stature than other hobgoblins, with bowed legs and massive shoulders. Hobgoblins with this racial trait gain a +2 racial bonus on Climb and Ride checks, and a +2 racial bonus to their CMD against bull

RacialTrait.Name: Battle-Hardened
RacialTrait.Description: Incessant drills make defense second nature to some hobgoblins. Hobgoblins with this racial trait gain a +1 bonus to CMD. This racial trait replaces sneaky.

RacialTrait.Name: Engineer
RacialTrait.Description: Hobgoblin engineers tinker endlessly with fire, explosives, and the engines of war. Hobgoblins with this racial trait gain a +2 racial bonus on Craft (alchemy) and Knowledge (engineering) checks. This racial trait replaces sneaky.

RacialTrait.Name: Fearsome
RacialTrait.Description: Some hobgoblins scorn caution and subtlety for swagger and bluster. Hobgoblins with this racial trait gain a +4 racial bonus on Intimidate checks. This racial trait replaces sneaky.

RacialTrait.Name: Magehunter
RacialTrait.Description: Hobgoblins hate and fear arcane casters. A magehunter gains a +2 racial bonus on Spellcraft checks made to identify a spell being cast and a +1 racial bonus on attack rolls against arcane spellcasters. He only gains this bonus against creatures that use s

RacialTrait.Name: Pit Boss
RacialTrait.Description: Slave blood fuels the hobgoblin war machine. Pit bosses extract the last breath of labor from their charges with a liberal touch of the lash. Hobgoblins with this racial trait gain proficiency with whips and a +1 racial bonus on combat maneuver checks mad

RacialTrait.Name: Scarred
RacialTrait.Description: A hobgoblin can scar himself with both blade and fire to toughen his hide into a mass of horny scars. Hobgoblins with this racial trait gain a +1 natural armor bonus to Armor Class. However, the repeated exposure to fire permanently damages their eyes. Th

RacialTrait.Name: Slave Hunter
RacialTrait.Description: Hobgoblin slavers excel at tracking down runaway slaves and surviving in filthy conditions. Hobgoblins with this racial trait gain a +2 racial bonus on Survival checks and a +2 racial bonus on Fortitude saves against disease. This racial trait replaces sn

RacialTrait.Name: Unfit
RacialTrait.Description: Unfit Hobgoblins who failed to secure a position in the military hold the lowest status in hobgoblin society, and quickly learn the value of currying favor with their betters. Hobgoblins with this racial trait gain proficiency in a single martial weapon and +1 racial bonus on Bluff and Diplomacy checks.

RacialTrait.Name: Stat Choice
RacialTrait.Description: Human characters get a +2 bonus to one ability score of their choice at creation to represent their varied nature.

RacialTrait.Name: Medium
RacialTrait.Description: Humans are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

RacialTrait.Name: Normal Speed
RacialTrait.Description: Humans have a base speed of 30 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Bonus Feat
RacialTrait.Description: Humans select one extra feat at 1st level.

RacialTrait.Name: Skilled
RacialTrait.Description: Humans gain an additional skill rank at first level and one additional rank whenever they gain a level.

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Humans begin play speaking Common. Humans with high Intelligence scores can choose any languages they want (except secret languages, such as Druidic).

RacialTrait.Name: Adoptive Parentage
RacialTrait.Description: Humans are sometimes orphaned and adopted by other races. Choose one humanoid race without the human subtype. You start play with that race's languages and gain that race's weapon familiarity racial trait (if any). If the race does not have weapon familia

RacialTrait.Name: Dual Talent
RacialTrait.Description: Some humans are uniquely skilled at maximizing their natural gifts. These humans pick two ability scores and gain a +2 racial bonus in each of those scores. This racial trait replaces the +2 bonus to any one ability score, the bonus feat, and the skilled

RacialTrait.Name: Eye for Talent
RacialTrait.Description: Humans have great intuition for hidden potential. They gain a +2 racial bonus on Sense Motive checks. In addition, when they acquire an animal companion, bonded mount, cohort, or familiar, that creature gains a +2 bonus to one ability score of the charact

RacialTrait.Name: Focused Study
RacialTrait.Description: All humans are skillful, but some, rather than being generalists, tend to specialize in a handful of skills. At 1st, 8th, and 16th level, such humans gain Skill Focus in a skill of their choice as a bonus feat. This racial trait replaces the bonus feat tr

RacialTrait.Name: Heart of the Fields
RacialTrait.Description: Humans born in rural areas are used to hard labor. They gain a racial bonus equal to half their character level to any one Craft or Profession skill, and once per day they may ignore an effect that would cause them to become fatigued or exhausted. This ra

RacialTrait.Name: Heart of the Mountains
RacialTrait.Description: Humans born in the mountains are skilled at negotiating heights and precipices. They gain a +2 racial bonus on Climb checks and Acrobatics checks to move on narrow surfaces and uneven ground. Furthermore, they are considered acclimated to the effects of h

RacialTrait.Name: Heart of the Sea
RacialTrait.Description: Humans born near the sea are always drawn to it. They gain a +2 racial bonus on Profession (sailor) and Swim checks, and these are always class skills for them. They can hold their breath twice as long as normal, and spellcasters gain a +4 racial bonus on

RacialTrait.Name: Heart of the Slums
RacialTrait.Description: Humans who eke out a life in a city's teeming slums must be quick and clever. They gain a +2 racial bonus on Sleight of Hand and Stealth checks, and a +4 racial bonus on Survival checks in urban and underground settings. In addition, they may roll twice w

RacialTrait.Name: Heart of the Snows
RacialTrait.Description: Humans born in chilly climes treat cold climates as one category less severe. They gain a +2 racial bonus on Fortitude saving throws against the effects of cold climates, on any check or saving throw to avoid slipping and falling, and to CMD against trip

RacialTrait.Name: Heart of the Streets
RacialTrait.Description: Humans from bustling cities are skilled with crowds. They gain a +1 racial bonus on Reflex saves and a +1 dodge bonus to Armor Class when adjacent to at least two other allies. Crowds do not count as difficult terrain for them. This racial trait replaces

RacialTrait.Name: Heart of the Sun
RacialTrait.Description: Humans born in tropical climates treat hot climates as one category less severe. They also gain a +2 racial bonus on Fortitude saving throws against the effects of a hot climate, as well as against the poison and distraction ability of swarms and vermin.

RacialTrait.Name: Heart of the Wilderness
RacialTrait.Description: Humans raised in the wild learn the hard way that only the strong survive. They gain a racial bonus equal to half their character level on Survival checks. They also gain a +5 racial bonus on Constitution checks to stabilize when dying and add half their

RacialTrait.Name: Heroic
RacialTrait.Description: Some humans are born heroes. In campaigns that use the optional hero point system, each time these humans gain a level, they gain 2 hero points instead of 1. If they take the Blood of Heroes feat, they gain 3 hero points each level instead of 2. This raci

RacialTrait.Name: Mixed Heritage
RacialTrait.Description: Often human civilization is defined by more than one characteristic. A human with this trait may select a second Heart of the racial trait. This replaces the bonus feat racial trait.

RacialTrait.Name: Silver Tongued
RacialTrait.Description: Human are often adept at subtle manipulation and putting even sworn foes at ease. Humans with this trait gain a +2 bonus on Diplomacy and Bluff checks. In addition, when they use Diplomacy to shift a creature's attitude, they can shift up to three steps u

RacialTrait.Name: Stats
RacialTrait.Description: +2 Dexterity, +2 Charisma, –2 Wisdom Ifrits are passionate and quick, but impetuous and destructive.

RacialTrait.Name: Native Outsider
RacialTrait.Description: Ifrits are outsiders with the native subtype.

RacialTrait.Name: Medium
RacialTrait.Description: Ifrits are Medium creatures and receive no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

RacialTrait.Name: Normal Speed
RacialTrait.Description: Ifrits have a base speed of 30 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Darkvision
RacialTrait.Description: Ifrits can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Spell-Like Ability
RacialTrait.Description: Burning hands 1/day (caster level equals the ifrit's level).

RacialTrait.Name: Energy Resistance Ifrit
RacialTrait.Description: Ifrits have fire resistance 5.

RacialTrait.Name: Fire Affinity
RacialTrait.Description: Ifrit sorcerers with the elemental (fire) bloodline treat their Charisma score as 2 points higher for all sorcerer spells and class abilities. Ifrit spellcasters with the Fire domain use their domain powers and spells at +1 caster level.

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Ifrits begin play speaking Common and Ignan. Ifrits with high Intelligence scores can choose from the following

RacialTrait.Name: Desert Mirage
RacialTrait.Description: Ifrits thrive in the deserts of the world, where their keen instincts and resistance to heat give them a huge edge over their competitors. Those with this trait gain a +2 racial bonus on Stealth checks in desert environments and on saves to resist starvat

RacialTrait.Name: Efreeti Magic
RacialTrait.Description: Some ifrits inherit an efreeti ancestor's ability to magically change a creature's size. They can cast either enlarge person or reduce person (the ifrit chooses when using this ability) once per day as a spell-like ability (caster level equals the ifrit's

RacialTrait.Name: Fire in the Blood
RacialTrait.Description: Ifrits with this racial trait mimic the healing abilities of the mephits, gaining fast healing 2 for 1 round anytime they take fire damage (whether or not this fire damage gets through their fire resistance). The ifrits can heal up to 2 hit points per lev

RacialTrait.Name: Fire Insight
RacialTrait.Description: Ifrit spellcasters sometimes find that their elemental heritage makes creatures of fire more willing to serve them. Summon monster and summon nature's ally spells that the ifrit casts last 2 rounds longer than normal when used to summon creatures with the

RacialTrait.Name: Fire-Starter
RacialTrait.Description: Ifrits with this racial trait derive sadistic satisfaction from watching others burn. Anytime the ifrit causes a creature to catch fire, he gains a +1 morale bonus on the next single attack roll, saving throw, skill check, or ability check that he makes i

RacialTrait.Name: Forge-Hardened
RacialTrait.Description: Not all ifrits are descended from efreet—some instead descend from azers or even salamanders. Such ifrits gain a +2 racial bonus on Craft (armor and weapons) checks and saves to resist fatigue and exhaustion. This racial trait replaces the spell-like abil

RacialTrait.Name: Hypnotic
RacialTrait.Description: Ifrits with this racial trait evoke the entrancing nature of flame, adding +1 to the DC for all saving throws against spells or effects they cast that inflict the fascinated condition. Once per day, when a creature rolls a saving throw against such an eff

RacialTrait.Name: Stats
RacialTrait.Description: Kitsune are agile and companionable, but tend to be physically weak. +2 Dexterity, +2 Charisma, –2 Strength

RacialTrait.Name: Medium
RacialTrait.Description: Kitsune are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

RacialTrait.Name: Kitsune
RacialTrait.Description: Kitsune are humanoids with the kitsune and shapechanger subtypes.

RacialTrait.Name: Normal Speed
RacialTrait.Description: Kitsune have a base speed of 30 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Low-Light Vision
RacialTrait.Description: Kitsune can see twice as far as humans in conditions of dim light.

RacialTrait.Name: Change Shape
RacialTrait.Description: A kitsune can assume the appearance of a specific single human form of the same sex. The kitsune always takes this specific form when she uses this ability. A kitsune in human form cannot use her bite attack, but gains a +10 racial bonus on Disguise check

RacialTrait.Name: Agile
RacialTrait.Description: Kitsune receive a +2 racial bonus on Acrobatics checks.

RacialTrait.Name: Kitsune Magic
RacialTrait.Description: Kitsune add +1 to the DC of any saving throws against enchantment spells that they cast. Kitsune with a Charisma score of 11 or higher gain the following spell-like ability

RacialTrait.Name: Natural Weapons
RacialTrait.Description: In her natural form, a kitsune has a bite attack that deals 1d4 points of damage.

RacialTrait.Name: Languages
RacialTrait.Description: Kitsune begin play speaking Common and Sylvan. Kitsune with high Intelligence scores can choose from the following

RacialTrait.Name: Fast Shifter
RacialTrait.Description: You were born with an innate talent for switching between your natural forms. Using your racial change shape ability is a move action instead of a standard action. This racial trait replaces kitsune magic.

RacialTrait.Name: Gregarious
RacialTrait.Description: Even among your own kind, your gift for making friends stands out. Whenever you successfully use Diplomacy to win over an individual, that creature takes a –2 penalty to resist any of your Charisma-based skill checks for the next 24 hours. This racial tra

RacialTrait.Name: Stats
RacialTrait.Description: +2 Dexterity, –4 Strength, –2 Constitution Kobolds are fast but weak.

RacialTrait.Name: Reptilian
RacialTrait.Description: Kobolds are humanoids with the reptilian subtype.

RacialTrait.Name: Small
RacialTrait.Description: Kobolds are Small creatures and gain a +1 size bonus to their AC, a +1 size bonus on attack rolls, a –1 penalty on their combat maneuver checks and to Combat Maneuver Defense, and a +4 size bonus on Stealth checks.

RacialTrait.Name: Normal Speed
RacialTrait.Description: Kobolds have a base speed of 30 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Darkvision
RacialTrait.Description: Kobolds can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

RacialTrait.Name: Armor
